tools.name: ASANA_ADD_FOLLOWERS_TO_TASK

opt_pretty.title: Opt Pretty
opt_pretty.description: Provides “pretty” output. Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

tools.name: ASANA_CREATE_ALLOCATION
tools.description: Creates a new allocation. Use when you need to schedule or assign a specific amount of a user's time per week to a task or project within a defined period.

notes.title: Notes

workspace_gid.title: Workspace Gid

tools.name: ASANA_CREATE_A_PROJECT
tools.description: Creates a new Asana project, requiring either a `workspace` or `team` GID for association, and returns the full project details.

inputSchema.title: CreateAProjectRequest

data.title: Data

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the project, ideally a short sentence fragment for UI readability.

team.title: Team
team.description: The GID of the team to associate with this project. Either team or workspace must be provided (not both).

notes.title: Notes
examples: This project is for the Q4 marketing campaign.
Key objectives and deliverables for the new product launch.
notes.description: Free-form textual information or description for the project.

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: User GID of the project owner (e.g., 'me', '12345'). Null implies default or no specific owner.

due_on.title: Due On
due_on.description: The date on which this project is due, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

archived.title: Archived
archived.description: True to archive the project. Archived projects are typically hidden in the UI and may alter query results.

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: Deprecated: New integrations should prefer the `due_on` field. The date on which this project is due, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

start_on.title: Start On
start_on.description: The date on which work for this project begins, in YYYY-MM-DD format. If setting this, `due_on` must also be provided and be different from `start_on`.

followers.title: Followers
followers.description: Create-only. Comma-separated user GIDs to follow the project (e.g., '12345,me'). Followers receive notifications for added tasks.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The GID of the workspace to associate with this project. Either team or workspace must be provided (not both).

html_notes.title: Html Notes
html_notes.description: HTML representation of project notes. May require `opt_fields` in parent request for population.

custom_fields.title: Custom Fields
custom_fields.description: Object mapping Custom Field GIDs to their values (enum GIDs, strings, numbers, objects). Use the ASANA_GET_CUSTOM_FIELDS_FOR_WORKSPACE action to fetch available custom fields for your workspace. Refer to Asana API documentation for value formats.

privacy_setting.title: Privacy Setting
privacy_setting.description: Privacy setting of the project. Allowed values: public_to_workspace, private_to_team, private. Organization administrators may restrict available values.

default_access_level.title: Default Access Level
default_access_level.description: Default access level for new project members.

minimum_access_level_for_sharing.title: Minimum Access Level For Sharing
minimum_access_level_for_sharing.description: Minimum access level required for project members to share the project and manage its memberships.

minimum_access_level_for_customization.title: Minimum Access Level For Customization
minimum_access_level_for_customization.description: Minimum access level required for project members to modify this project's workflow and appearance.

data.description: Data payload for the new project.

opt_fields.title: Opt Fields
opt_fields.description: Array of optional properties to include in the response.

opt_pretty.title: Opt Pretty
opt_pretty.description: True for human-readable JSON response (debugging only due to size/processing).

inputSchema.description: Request schema to create a new project in Asana.

tools.name: ASANA_CREATE_A_TAG_IN_A_WORKSPACE

inputSchema.title: CreateATagInAWorkspaceRequest

data.title: Data

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the tag. This should be a short, descriptive name that will be visible in the UI.

color.title: ColorEnum
color.description: Color of the tag chosen from predefined options. If not specified, Asana will assign a default color.

notes.title: Notes
examples: This tag is used to mark critical items.
notes.description: Free-form textual information or description associated with the tag.

data.description: The properties for the tag creation, including name (required), color (optional), and notes (optional).

opt_fields.title: Opt Fields
opt_fields.description: Comma-separated string of fields from `OptFieldsEnm0` (e.g., 'name', 'color') to include in the response; returns a compact representation by default.

opt_pretty.title: Opt Pretty
opt_pretty.description: If true, pretty-prints the JSON response; useful for debugging but may increase response size.

workspace_gid.title: Workspace Gid
workspace_gid.description: The globally unique identifier (GID) for the workspace or organization in which to create the tag.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for parameters used in `CreateATagInAWorkspace`. This model primarily defines query and path parameters, not the request body for tag creation itself.

tools.name: ASANA_CREATE_A_TASK
tools.description: Creates a new Asana task; requires 'workspace', 'parent', or 'projects' for association, and 'followers', 'projects', 'tags' are set only at creation.

inputSchema.title: CreateATaskRequest

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Create-Only: Array of tag GIDs. Use 'addTag'/'removeTag' for updates.

liked.title: Liked
liked.description: Indicates if the task is liked by the authorized user.

notes.title: Notes
examples: Detailed description of the task, including steps and expected outcomes.
notes.description: Free-form textual description of the task.

due_at.title: Due At
due_at.description: UTC due date and time (ISO 8601). Null if no due time. Mutually exclusive with 'due_on'.

due_on.title: Due On
due_on.description: Localized due date (YYYY-MM-DD). Null if no due date. Mutually exclusive with 'due_at'.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: GID of parent task for subtasks. Null for top-level tasks.

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: User GID to assign the task. 'me' for current user.

anyOf.title: ProjectInput
anyOf.description: Represents a project GID for task creation.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Create-Only: Array of project GIDs for association. Use 'addProject'/'removeProject' for updates.

start_at.title: Start At
start_at.description: UTC start date and time (ISO 8601). Null if no start time. Mutually exclusive with 'start_on'. `due_at` is required if `start_at` is set/unset.

start_on.title: Start On
start_on.description: Localized start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Null if no start date. Mutually exclusive with 'start_at'. `due_on` or `due_at` is required if `start_on` is set/unset.

completed.title: Completed
completed.description: Indicates if the task is complete.

followers.title: Followers
followers.description: Create-Only: Array of user identifiers (GID, email, 'me') for followers. Use 'addFollowers'/'removeFollowers' actions for updates.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: Workspace/organization GID. Required unless 'parent' or 'projects' specified.

html_notes.title: Html Notes
html_notes.description: Opt-in: Task notes with HTML formatting for rich text.

custom_fields.title: Custom Fields
custom_fields.description: Object mapping custom field GIDs to their values (e.g., enum GID, string, number). Use the ASANA_GET_CUSTOM_FIELDS_FOR_WORKSPACE action to fetch available custom fields for your workspace. See Asana docs for update details.

approval_status.title: ApprovalStatus
approval_status.description: Approval status (e.g., 'pending', 'approved'). Synchronized with 'completed': 'pending' means incomplete; 'approved', 'rejected', 'changes_requested' mean complete. Setting 'completed' to true sets this to 'approved'.

assignee_status.title: AssigneeStatus
assignee_status.description: Deprecated: Scheduling status for the assignee (e.g., 'upcoming', 'today'). Should only be set if assignee is provided. 'inbox'/'upcoming' place task at top of assignee's list section; others at bottom.

assignee_section.title: Assignee Section
assignee_section.description: GID of assignee's 'My tasks' section. Only writable if section is visible in user's 'My tasks'.

resource_subtype.title: ResourceSubtype
resource_subtype.description: Subtype of the task (e.g., 'default_task', 'milestone'). Milestone tasks cannot have a 'start_date'.

opt_fields.title: Opt Fields
opt_fields.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties for response. Default is compact resource.

opt_pretty.title: Opt Pretty
opt_pretty.description: Provides 'pretty' JSON output with line breaks/indentation. Useful for debugging; may increase response time/size.

parent_gid.description: Globally unique identifier for the parent task or comment.

file_content.description: The file content to be uploaded.

connect_to_app.description: Whether to connect the attachment to the app. If true, the attachment will be displayed in the Asana UI as an app attachment. If false, the attachment will be displayed as a regular file attachment. Defaults to true.

resource_subtype.title: Resource Subtype
resource_subtype.description: The type of the attachment. Must be one of the given values. If not specified, a regular file attachment will be created. If 'asana' is specified, the attachment will be a link to another Asana task. If 'external' is specified, the attachment will be a link to an external resource. If 'gdrive' is specified, the attachment will be a link to a Google Drive file. If 'box' is specified, the attachment will be a link to a Box file. If 'dropbox' is specified, the attachment will be a link to a Dropbox file. If 'vimeo' is specified, the attachment will be a link to a Vimeo video.

data.title: Data

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the new enum option. Required if 'enum_option' (GID of existing option) is not provided.

color.title: Color
color.description: The color for the new enum option (e.g., "blue", "red"). Used if creating a new option.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the new enum option is enabled. Defaults to true. Used if creating a new option.

enum_option.title: Enum Option
enum_option.description: The GID of an existing enum option to move. Required if 'name' is not provided (i.e., if reordering an existing option).

insert_after.title: Insert After
insert_after.description: GID of an existing enum option. The option specified by 'name' or 'enum_option' will be placed after this GID. One of 'insert_before' or 'insert_after' must be provided.

insert_before.title: Insert Before
insert_before.description: GID of an existing enum option. The option specified by 'name' or 'enum_option' will be placed before this GID. One of 'insert_before' or 'insert_after' must be provided.

data.description: The data for the enum option to be inserted or reordered.

tools.name: ASANA_UPDATE_A_TASK
tools.description: Updates attributes of an existing Asana task identified by its task_gid.

inputSchema.title: UpdateATaskRequest

data.title: Data

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the task. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability, but it can be longer.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An array of tag GIDs to associate with the task. Setting this field replaces all existing tags on the task. To add or remove specific tags incrementally, use the `addTag` or `removeTag` actions.

liked.title: Liked
liked.description: True if the task is liked by the authorized user, false if not.

notes.title: Notes
examples: This is a critical task for the project launch.
notes.description: Free-form textual information associated with the task (i.e., its description).

due_at.title: Due At
due_at.description: The UTC date and time on which this task is due (e.g., '2023-09-15T02:06:58.147Z'). Null if the task has no due time. This takes an ISO 8601 date string and should not be used together with `due_on`.

due_on.title: Due On
due_on.description: The localized date on which this task is due (e.g., '2023-09-15'). Null if the task has no due date. This takes a date with YYYY-MM-DD format and should not be used together with `due_at`.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: The GID of the parent task, if this task is to be updated as a subtask. Set to `null` to convert a subtask to a top-level task.

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: The GID of the user to assign the task to. Can be the string 'me' to assign to the authenticated user, or an email address.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: An array of project GIDs to associate the task with. Setting this field replaces all existing project associations for the task. To add or remove specific projects incrementally, use the `addProject` or `removeProject` actions.

start_at.title: Start At
start_at.description: The UTC date and time on which work begins for the task (e.g., '2023-09-14T09:00:00.000Z'). Null if the task has no start time. This takes an ISO 8601 date string in UTC and should not be used together with `start_on`. *Note: `due_at` must be present in the request when setting or unsetting the `start_at` parameter.*

start_on.title: Start On
start_on.description: The localized date on which work begins for the task (e.g., '2023-09-14'). Null if the task has no start date. This takes a date with YYYY-MM-DD format and should not be used together with `start_at`. *Note: `due_on` or `due_at` must be present in the request when setting or unsetting the `start_on` parameter.*

completed.title: Completed
completed.description: True if the task is currently marked complete, false if not.

followers.title: Followers
followers.description: An array of user GIDs, email addresses, or the string 'me' to set as followers. Setting this field replaces all existing followers on the task. To add or remove specific followers incrementally, use the `addFollowers` or `removeFollowers` actions.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The GID of the workspace to associate the task with. This is usually only required if the task is being moved between workspaces, which is a rare operation.

html_notes.title: Html Notes
html_notes.description: The notes of the task, with formatting as HTML. This field is available only by Opt-In.

custom_type.title: Custom Type
custom_type.description: The GID of the custom type for the task. This is relevant for tasks using specific task type configurations.

custom_fields.title: Custom Fields
custom_fields.description: An object where each key is the GID of a custom field and its corresponding value is the new value for that custom field. The value can be an enum GID, string, number, object, or array, depending on the custom field type. Use the ASANA_GET_CUSTOM_FIELDS_FOR_WORKSPACE action to fetch available custom fields for your workspace. Refer to Asana's custom fields documentation for details.

approval_status.title: ApprovalStatus
approval_status.description: Reflects the approval status of this task. This field is kept in sync with `completed`, meaning `pending` translates to false while `approved`, `rejected`, and `changes_requested` translate to true. If you set `completed` to true, this field will be set to `approved`.

assignee_status.title: AssigneeStatus
assignee_status.description: Deprecated: Scheduling status of this task for the user it is assigned to. This field can only be set if the assignee is non-null. Setting this field to `inbox` or `upcoming` inserts it at the top of the section, while other options will insert at the bottom.

assignee_section.title: Assignee Section
assignee_section.description: The GID of the assignee's section in their 'My tasks' list where the task should be placed. This is applicable only if the task is assigned to a user and the section exists and is visible in their 'My tasks' list. This field is returned in the response only if the request is made by the task's assignee.

resource_subtype.title: ResourceSubtype
resource_subtype.description: The subtype of this resource. Different subtypes retain many of the same fields and behavior, but may render differently in Asana or represent resources with different semantic meaning. The `milestone` resource_subtype represents a single moment in time and tasks with this subtype cannot have a start_date.

custom_type_status_option.title: Custom Type Status Option
custom_type_status_option.description: The GID of the status option for the custom task type. This is used in conjunction with `custom_type`.

data.description: An object containing the fields of the task to update.

task_gid.title: Task Gid
task_gid.description: The GID of the task to update.

opt_fields.title: Opt Fields
opt_fields.description: A list of optional properties to include in the response object. By default, a compact representation of the task is returned. Use this to retrieve additional fields. The elements of this list should be valid field names for the task resource.

opt_pretty.title: Opt Pretty
opt_pretty.description: If true, the response JSON will be 'pretty-printed' with indentation and line breaks, making it more readable. This is useful for debugging but may increase response time and size.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for updating an existing task.
